metadata.title: CVE-2023-32269 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.1.11. Innet/netrom/af_netrom.c, there is a use-after-free because accept is alsoallowed for a successfully connected AF_NETROM socket. However, in orderfor an attacker to exploit this, the system must have netrom routingconfigured or the attacker must have the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-lowlatency - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-kvm - 4.4.0-1124.134
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1161-aws - 4.4.0-1161.176
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-aws - 4.15.0-1156.169~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-azure - 4.15.0-1165.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-gcp - 4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-oracle - 4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.134').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
